description: Coordinate health status API integration and testing timeline for W3 Health Monitoring

context.background: mcp-orchestration will provide health status API (Week 8 delivery) for mcp-gateway to consume for health-aware routing
context.relationship: Downstream consumer - mcp-gateway depends on our health API

questions.question: What response format do you expect for health status API? JSON schema, required fields?
Real-time WebSocket or HTTP polling preference? Or both?
questions.our_capability: Can provide both (Wave 2.0 supports HTTP/SSE and WebSocket)

questions.question: Performance budget for health queries? Our target: p95 <100ms, is that sufficient?
Ready for integration testing Week 9? Integration test environment available?
questions.our_delivery: Health status API v1.0 ready Week 8 (Dec 20)

questions.question: Error handling expectations if orchestration unavailable? Graceful degradation strategy?
questions.our_approach: Will return 503 with retry-after header if degraded

questions.question: Test data requirements? How many servers, what health states needed for testing?
questions.importance: Medium - helps us prepare test environment
questions.our_offer: Can provide 5 sample servers (3 healthy, 1 degraded, 1 down)

questions.question: Acceptance criteria for integration test? What validates 'success'?
questions.our_proposal: All test servers queryable, <100ms response, graceful degradation

questions.question: On-call support needs during integration? Slack/GitHub, response SLA?

deliverables_we_provide.details: RESTful HTTP endpoints for querying server health

deliverables_we_provide.value: 15 min for mcp-gateway to understand API

value_proposition.for_mcp_gateway: Reduces integration effort by ~40% (6h â†’ 3.5h estimated)
value_proposition.for_ecosystem: Validates health monitoring pattern for other MCP servers
